actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.

actions.subcommittee: International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services
actions.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on International Security, Proliferation and Federal Services

official_title: A bill to amend chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, to increase the Government contribution for Federal employee health insurance.
short_title: Federal Employees Health Benefits Improvement Act of 2002

summary.text: Federal Employees Health Benefits Improvement Act of 2002 - Increases the biweekly contribution payable by the Government for a Federal employee or annuitant enrolled in a Federal employee health insurance plan to 80 (currently 72) percent of the weighted average of the subscription charges, not to exceed 83 (currently 75) percent of the subscription charge for the specific plan involved.

titles.title: Federal Employees Health Benefits Improvement Act of 2002
A bill to amend chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code, to increase the Government contribution for Federal employee health insurance.
